snippet: Rookie All-Stars Bryce Harper and Mike Trout, at ages 19 and 20, have come a long way in a short time since playing with the Scottsdale Scorpions of the Arizona Fall League.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column asserts that Washington Nationals outfielder Bryce Harper and Los Angeles Angels outfielder Mike Trout, two of the five rookies playing in the All-Star Game, are baseball's next big stars.
lead_paragraph: Rookie All-Stars Bryce Harper and Mike Trout, at ages 19 and 20, have come a long way in a short time since playing with the Scottsdale Scorpions of the Arizona Fall League.

headline.print_headline: New Faces Of Baseball And Having A Blast
headline.seo: Rookie All-Stars Harper and Trout Are Having a Blast
headline.main: New Faces of Baseball and Having a Blast
